```{r import_NYPD_data}

NYPD_Url <- read_csv("https://data.cityofnewyork.us/api/views/833y-fsy8/rows.csv?accessType=DOWNLOAD")

```
```{r tidy_NYPD_data}

summary(NYPD_Url)
NYPD_Data <- as.data.frame(NYPD_Url)

is_na_or_null <- function(NYPD_Data) {
  is.na(NYPD_Data) || is.null(NYPD_Data)
  as.logical()
}

NYPD_Data <- NYPD_Data %>%
  select(-c(Longitude, Lon_Lat, Latitude, X_COORD_CD, Y_COORD_CD, LOC_OF_OCCUR_DESC, LOC_CLASSFCTN_DESC)) %>%
  rename(date = OCCUR_DATE, time = OCCUR_TIME, location = LOCATION_DESC, jurisdiction = JURISDICTION_CODE, boro = BORO, perp_age = PERP_AGE_GROUP, perp_sex = PERP_SEX, perp_race = PERP_RACE, vic_age = VIC_AGE_GROUP, vic_sex = VIC_SEX, vic_race = VIC_RACE, murder_flag = STATISTICAL_MURDER_FLAG, precinct = PRECINCT, incident_key = INCIDENT_KEY) %>%
  mutate(date = mdy(date)) %>%
  na.omit(NYPD_Data)

#add in null data omit and mutate time
#look back at COVID Data

split_NYPD_Data <- split.data.frame(NYPD_Data, NYPD_Data$boro)

brooklyn_data <- split_NYPD_Data$BROOKLYN
bronx_data <- split_NYPD_Data$BRONX
manhattan_data <- split_NYPD_Data$MANHATTAN
queens_data <- split_NYPD_Data$QUEENS
staten_island_data <- split_NYPD_Data$`STATEN ISLAND`


```

```{r filter_boro_data}

brooklyn_data <- brooklyn_data %>%
  group_by(precinct, jurisdiction, date) %>%
  summarize(perp_age = as.vector(perp_age), vic_age = as.vector(vic_age), murder_flag = TRUE) %>%
  ungroup()
summary(brooklyn_data)


bronx_data <- bronx_data %>%
  group_by(precinct, jurisdiction, date) %>%
  summarize(perp_age = as.vector(perp_age), vic_age = as.vector(vic_age), murder_flag = TRUE) %>%
  ungroup()
summary(bronx_data)


manhattan_data <- manhattan_data %>%
  group_by(precinct, jurisdiction, date) %>%
  summarize(perp_age = as.vector(perp_age), vic_age = as.vector(vic_age), murder_flag = TRUE) %>%
  ungroup()
summary(manhattan_data)


staten_island_data <- staten_island_data %>%
  group_by(precinct, jurisdiction, date) %>%
  summarize(perp_age = as.vector(perp_age), vic_age = as.vector(vic_age), murder_flag = TRUE) %>%
  ungroup()

summary(staten_island_data)


queens_data <- queens_data %>%
  group_by(precinct, jurisdiction, date) %>%
  summarize(perp_age = as.vector(perp_age), vic_age = as.vector(vic_age), murder_flag = TRUE) %>%
  ungroup()

summary(queens_data)

```

```{r modeling_NYPD_data}


NYPD_Data <- slice_sample(NYPD_Data, n = 100000000)
NYPD_model <- lm(PRECINCT ~ JURISDICTION_CODE, data = NYPD_Data)
summary(NYPD_model)


```


## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r plot_NYPD_shooting_data, echo=FALSE}

NYPD_Data <- as.data.frame(NYPD_Data)

NYPD_plot <- NYPD_Data %>%
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = PRECINCT, y = JURISDICTION_CODE, color = "blue")) + 
      geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(method = lm, formula = x ~ y, se = FALSE, color = "red")

NYPD_plot


manhattan_data <- as.data.frame(manhattan_data)

Manhattan_plot <- manhattan_data %>%
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = precinct, y = jurisdiction, color = "yellow")) + 
  geom_point()

Manhattan_plot

```
```{r Conclusion}

print("Possible sources of bias within the data could include any shootings that are not reported to the police by the public or any shootings that the police themselves may have committed.  My personal bias would be that I was analyizing from the perspective of police-committed crimes to begin with and then began reading the data as civilian-committed crimes.")
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
